items.title: JS0 + JSSugar not so sweet?
items.content:
#â€‹709 â€” October 17, 2024

Read on the Web

JavaScript Weekly

The Story of Web Framework Hono, By Its Creator â€” Hono is a neat, lightweight framework designed to run on any JavaScript runtime that has been picking up steam in the past year. You can create a simple app reminiscent of Express.js, say, but run it on Cloudflare Workers, Deno, Bun, or Node. Itâ€™s in heavy use all over the place, and has lots of interesting features like letting you write HTML withÂ JSX.

Yusuke Wada

Supercharge Your Node.js Code Reviews with AI â€” Tired of event loop bottlenecks, async errors, and dependency vulnerabilities slipping through code reviews? CodeRabbit, an AI-powered code review tool, analyzes your codebase line-by-line, detecting perf issues, optimizing async patterns, and enhancing security with each pullÂ request.

CodeRabbit sponsor

Node v23.0.0 (Current) Released â€” Say hello to the newest release line of Node.js that gets all the cutting edge features first (Node 22 will soon become an LTS release as per the usual schedule). Node v23 notably enables support for loading ES modules with require() by default, drops 32-bit Windows support, and node --run goesÂ stable.

Rafael Gonzaga

JS0/JSSugar: 'The Tooling Will Continue Until Morale Improves' â€” In a rather quirky slidedeck presented at TC39 recently, an idea was floated to call the language JS engines implement â€˜JS0â€™ and a myriad of features that have to be compiled to JS0 â€˜JSSugarâ€™. It might not surprise you that this idea is considered.. controversial and â–¶ï¸ Theo Browne did a 25-minute video digging into itÂ further.

Caolan

IN BRIEF:

  • Greensock's popular JavaScript animation library GSAP has been acquired by Webflow â€“ it'll continue to be updated and maintained as before.

  • Did you know setTimeout struggles to set timeouts longer than 25 days (or 2^31 milliseconds) in duration? Never fear: Evan Hahn unveils setBigTimeout.

  • quickjs-cross-compiler provides a way to generate static binaries of JavaScript apps for x86_64, i686, ARM 7, andÂ ARM64.

RELEASES:

  • Electron 33 â€“ The popular way to build cross-platform desktop apps gets a bump up to Chromium 30, Node 20.18, V8 13, but drops macOS 10.15Â support.

  • Wasp 0.15 â€“ Wasp is a Rails-like framework using Node, React &Â Prisma.

  • Zustand 5.0 â€“ Simple, flux-inspired state management forÂ React.

  • Javet 4.0 â€“ Java + V8. Embed Node.js and V8 intoÂ Java.

  • Next.js 15 Release Candidate 2, Node.js 22.10.0 (Current), Jasmine 5.4

ğŸ“’Â Articles & Tutorials

How to Build an Image Search App with CLIP, Postgres & JavaScript â€” A tutorial that brings together a lot of ideas in one place. CLIP is used to turn images into text descriptions. Postgres is used as a vector database. JavaScript provides the glue for both the frontend (with React) and backend (Node.js).

Haziqa Sajid

Using Sibling Parameters as Default Values in Functions â€” function myFunc(arg1, arg2 = arg1)? A technique safely in the â€˜not a lot of people know you can do thatâ€™ pile. Alex digs into it a bit and looks at some useÂ cases.

Alex MacArthur

[Guide] Debugging Microservices & Distributed Systems â€” Learn best practices on understanding and debugging modern web applications. Read theÂ guide.

Sentry sponsor

Liskov's Gun: The Parallel Evolution of React and Web Components â€” An opinion piece so long thereâ€™s an EPUB version. Baldur tackles Web Components, their growing pains, why frameworks like React took a different path, and why the whole topic remains a difficult circle toÂ square.

Baldur Bjarnason

React Folder Structure in Five Steps, 2024 Edition â€” Articles about structuring React apps are always popular; this one breaks the idea down to five steps from the simplest of apps to more complex ones. Bulletproof React is worth a look too for somethingÂ broader.

Robin Wieruch

Optimize Your Builds with Depotâ€™s GitHub Actions Price Calculator â€” Depot just launched a GitHub Actions price calculator. Get a cost breakdown and make your builds faster andÂ cheaper!

Depot / GitHub Actions Price Calculator sponsor

ğŸ“„ ğŸ«£ Implementing Regular Expressions in TypeScript Types (Badly) â€“ Itâ€™s almost Halloween so scary stories areÂ welcome. Steven Kalt

ğŸ“„ 'I Interviewed 100 DevTools Founders and This Is What I Learned' Jack Bridger

ğŸ“„ Handling In-Browser Paste Events in JavaScript Raymond Camden

ğŸ“„ The Nuances of Base64 Encoding Strings in JavaScript Matt Joseph

ğŸ“„ How to Convert CommonJS to ESM Andy Jiang

ğŸ› Â Code & Tools

ApexCharts: Flexible Interactive Charting Library â€” A mature and frequently updated charting library for creating interactive data visualizations, with sparklines, heatmaps, line charts, funnel charts, pies, and others. Can be used in a vanilla way or alongside Angular, Vue or React and there are lots of live examples (with code for each). GitHubÂ repo.

ApexCharts

Over 100 Algorithms and Data Structures Demonstrated in JS â€” Examples of numerous common algorithms (e.g. bit manipulation, Pascalâ€™s triangle, Hamming distance) and data structures (e.g. linked lists, tries, graphs) withÂ explanations.

Oleksii Trekhleb et al.

Developer Kit: Learn How to Troubleshoot Front-End Issues Faster â€” Get the kit curated to help front-end developers better understand user activity and resolve issues moreÂ efficiently.

Datadog sponsor

fast-grid: The World's Most Performant DOM-Based Web Table? â€” A bold claim, but you can see for yourself using the online demo, which lets you filter, sort, and scroll simultaneously for a trueÂ test.

Gabriel Petersson

ğŸ¨Â Color Thief: Grab Color Palettes from Images â€” Given an image, this uses canvas to return a list of the dominant colors. Works in browsers orÂ Node.

Lokesh Dhakar

Node Version Manager Desktop 4.0 â€” A Tauri-powered desktop app for macOS, Windows and Linux to manage multiple installed versions of Node on yourÂ system.

rainbow

ğŸ¹Â ChordSymbol: Chord Symbol Parser and Renderer â€” Accepts chord names in strings (e.g. G7/B, Cadd9, Asus2) and lets you access the notes those chords are made of. GitHubÂ repo.

Christophe NoÃ«l

  • debounce 2.2 â€“ Delay function calls until a set time elapses after the lastÂ invocation.

  • ğŸ˜³ NSFW.js 4.2 â€“ Client-side NSFW image detection viaÂ TensorFlow.js.

  • Secretlint 9.0 â€“ Tool to prevent committingÂ credentials/secrets.

  • â˜ï¸ vue-tel-input 9.2 â€“ Telephone number input for Vue.Â (Demo.)

  • ğŸ—“ï¸ Qalendar 3.9 â€“ Event calendar and date picker for Vue 3.

  • Vaul 1.1 â€“ Unstyled drawer ReactÂ component.Â (Demo.)

  • Mineflayer 4.22 â€“ Create Minecraft bots inÂ JavaScript.

  • FxTS 1.1 â€“ Functional programming library forÂ TS/JS.

ğŸ“°Â Classifieds

ğŸ¹ STRICH: Add blazing fast and reliable 1D/2D Barcode Scanning to your web apps. Free demo app and 30-day trialÂ available.

ğŸª Hookdeck: A serverless queue to reliably send, receive, transform, filter, and route events across your event-drivenÂ apps.

ğŸ’¥ Improve your database performance with AI. Prisma Optimize automatically analyzes your queries and helps you improveÂ them.

items.title: A huge week for ECMAScript proposals
items.content:
#â€‹708 â€” October 10, 2024

Read on the Web

JavaScript Weekly

TC39 Advances 10+ ECMAScript Proposals â€” The architects behind the development of the ECMAScript / JavaScript spec got together again this week (you can see them in this tweet) and they had a packed agenda. Import attributes, Iterator helpers, Promise.try and Regexp modifiers all made it to stage 4, and moreÂ besides.

Sarah Gooding (Socket)

ğŸ¦–Â Announcing Deno 2 â€” A huge release for the â€œwhat if I reinvented Node again from scratch?â€ runtime. Backwards compatibility with Node is a headline feature, but thereâ€™s a lot more baked in. Best, though, is the â–¶ï¸Â epic â€˜Announcing Deno 2â€™ video. After a slightly bombastic opener, Ryan presents a fantastic â€˜keynoteâ€™ style tour of everything Deno has to offer â€“ I enjoyed watchingÂ it.

Dahl, Belder, IwaÅ„czuk and Jiang

ğŸ’¡ A neat new feature is Deno's Jupyter Notebook support which Simon Willison checks outÂ here.

A Deeper Understanding of Web Security â€” Steve Kinney hosts this extensive video course on the challenges of web security. You'll gain a deeper understanding of security on the web, developing your mental model on how to approach things, explore common vulnerabilities, get hands-on experience with security tools, and get to grips with bestÂ practices.

Frontend Masters sponsor

Announcing TypeScript 5.7 Beta â€” The newest TypeScript is on the way. As always, a true laundry list of enhancements and new features, but the path rewriting for relative paths is a particularly welcome addition, enabling easy rewrites of .ts imports into .js at compileÂ time.

Microsoft

IN BRIEF:

  • Ian Grunert writes about work done to (re)enable JavaScriptCore's JIT mechanisms on Windows. This is particularly good news for Bun users.

  • Did you know MySQL 9.0 now natively supports JavaScript stored routines?

  • ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¸ The next JSNation event is taking place in a hybrid form both remotely and in New York City this November 18 andÂ 21. Some fantastic speakersÂ await.

  • Tenno is an interesting online Markdown editor that supports adding spreadsheet-like cells that can be populated byÂ JavaScript.

  • ğŸ•¹ï¸ The winners of the latest js13kGames game jam have been announced. It's amazing what people have managed to achieve in justÂ 13KB.

RELEASES:

  • Bun v1.1.30 â€“ Now includes experimental CSS parsing and bundling, as well as a bun publish to publish npm packages, a la npm publish. You can also compile code to bytecode to speed up startupÂ times.

  • Node.js v20.18.0 (LTS) â€“ Now with network inspection support.

  • React Native Storybook 8.3 â€“ React Native support in the popular component workshop finally gets fully up toÂ speed.

  • Rsdoctor 0.4 â€“ Tool for analyzing the Rspack / Webpack buildÂ process.

  • ESLint 9.12.0, Electron.js 32.2, Ember 5.12

ğŸ“’Â Articles & Tutorials

Building a Local Single-Page App with htmx â€” If you have a reasonably simple app to build, using a large framework is probably going to be overkill. htmx to the rescue! Jake presents an easily followed practical tutorial packed withÂ code.

Jake Lazaroff

ğŸ’¡ Jake also wrote an interesting case study of building a local-first app using SvelteKit and Shoelace, if you want to see something moreÂ fully-formed.

Product for Engineers: A Newsletter Helping Flex Your Product Muscle â€” Product for Engineers is dedicated to sharing the skills and strategies product engineers need toÂ succeed.

PostHog sponsor

Build a Static RSS Reader To Fight Your Inner FOMO â€” The theme of lightweight JavaScript apps continues with a look at creating a basic RSS feed reader, that updates once a day, withÂ Astro.

Karin Hendrikse

Node vs Bun: No Backend Performance Difference? â€” You can always trust a benchmark to ruffle some feathers, often over the methodology rather than the result. This is no exception, but interestingÂ nonetheless.

Evert Heylen

â–¶Â Â Building a Tic-Tac-Toe Game in TypeScript Types â€” One of those videos I enjoyed simply so I donâ€™t ever feel tempted to try itÂ myself.

Typed Rocks

Securing Node.js Express APIs with Clerk and React â€” Secure Express API endpoints and integrate authentication without the complexity of building it fromÂ scratch.

Clerk sponsor

ğŸ“„ Building a Robust Frontend using Progressive Enhancement UK Government

ğŸ“„ The Popover API: Your New Best Friend for Tooltips â€“ Supported in all major browsers, except Safari on iOS. Sjoerd Beentjes

ğŸ“„ 18 Interview Questions Answered by Angular Experts Angular Space

ğŸ“„ Testing CSS Print Media Styles with Cypress Gleb Bahmutov

ğŸ› Â Code & Tools

DOCX 9.0: Generate Word .docx Files from JavaScript â€” The code to lay out documents is verbose but thereâ€™s a lot of functionality baked in and there arenâ€™t many other options for this task. Hereâ€™s a CodePen-based example to give you an idea. GitHubÂ repo.

Dolan Miu

TinyJS: A Lightweight Way to Work with DOM Elements â€” Lighter than querySelector and friends, you ask? Not in file size, but certainly in code weight. TinyJS offers a jQuery-esque syntax for element selection, adding properties to elements, andÂ more.

Victor Ribeiro

Breakpoints and console.log Is the Past, Time Travel Is the Future â€” 15x faster JavaScript debugging than with breakpoints and console.log, supports Vitest, jest, karma, jasmine, andÂ more.

Wallaby Team sponsor

SVGuitar 2.4: Create SVG-Based Guitar Chord Charts â€” Dynamically generate chord charts / fingerings in the browser. You can experiment with it in this liveÂ demo.

Raphael Voellmy

Free Public APIs: A Collection of Free Public APIs for Developers â€” Categorized and searchable, these are tested daily by bots so if any API is taken down or moved behind a paywall, it's removed from theÂ site.

Nick Schneeberger

TutorialKit 1.0: Create Interactive Coding Tutorials â€” StackBlitzâ€™s framework for creating interactive coding tutorials, perhaps as a way to boost the adoption of your own libraries or design system. v1.0 marks TutorialKit asÂ stable.

StackBlitz

Jeasx: The Ease of JSX with the Power of SSR â€” A new server side rendering framework built on top of JSX andÂ Fastify.

Maik Jablonski

ip-address 10.0: Library for Parsing and Manipulating IP Addresses â€” Works with both IPv4 and IPv6Â addresses.

Beau Gunderson

  • React-Grid-Layout 1.5 â€“ Draggable/resizable grid layouts for ReactÂ apps.

  • ğŸ—“ï¸ Schedule-X 2.4 â€“ Material Design event calendar and dateÂ picker.

  • eslint-plugin-unicorn 56.0 â€“ 100+ useful ESLint rules in oneÂ place.

  • Redwood 8.4 â€“ Popular React appÂ framework.

ğŸ“°Â Classifieds

Automatically creates & maintains E2E UI tests. Zero flakes. Used by Lattice, Bilt Rewards and others. Backed by YC, CTO GitHub andÂ others.

Pythagora is an AI dev tool that builds production-ready tools (not demo apps). It writes the code and talks to you in theÂ process.

âš™ï¸ Create entire web apps with Reactile and let it handle your widgets and windows within a single browser tab. 1-month free trial. Try itÂ now.

Beau Gunderson 




React-Grid-Layout 1.5 â€“ Draggable/resizable grid layouts for ReactÂ apps.
ğŸ—“ï¸ Schedule-X 2.4 â€“ Material Design event calendar and dateÂ picker.
eslint-plugin-unicorn 56.0 â€“ 100+ useful ESLint rules in oneÂ place.
Redwood 8.4 â€“ Popular React appÂ framework.











	
ğŸ“°Â Classifieds


Automatically creates & maintains E2E UI tests. Zero flakes. Used by Lattice, Bilt Rewards and others. Backed by YC, CTO GitHub andÂ others.
Pythagora is an AI dev tool that builds production-ready tools (not demo apps). It writes the code and talks to you in theÂ process.
âš™ï¸ Create entire web apps with Reactile and let it handle your widgets and windows within a single browser tab. 1-month free trial. Try itÂ now.

items.title: Evan You's next big adventure
items.content:
#â€‹707 â€” October 3, 2024

Read on the Web

JavaScript Weekly

VoidZero: A Next-Generation Toolchain for JavaScript â€” Not content to have merely created Vue.js and Vite, JavaScript powerhouse Evan You has unveiled his latest adventure: a $4.6m funded company building an open-source unified development toolchain for the JavaScript ecosystem. With his track record, this is as good an attempt as itÂ gets.

Evan You

ESLint Now Officially Supports Linting JSON and Markdown â€” ESLint has been taking steps to become a more general purpose linter and that effort is beginning to bear fruit with thisÂ milestone.

Nicholas C. Zakas

Run GitHub Actions Up to 2x Faster at Half the Cost â€” Blacksmith runs your GitHub Actions substantially faster by running them on modern gaming CPUs. Integrating Blacksmith is a one-line code change. 100+ companies like Ashby, Superblocks, and Slope use Blacksmith to help developers merge codeÂ faster.

Blacksmith sponsor

Tauri 2.0: Small, Fast Desktop Apps using Web Technologies â€” Tauri is a Rust-based alternative to Electron for bringing together HTML, JavaScript and CSS code to create cross-platform desktop apps. Rather than using V8, it uses the natively available webview to run yourÂ code.

Tillmann Weidinger

IN BRIEF:

  • ğŸ˜ Build tool Vite has a snazzy new homepage just in time for ViteConf.

  • The Svelte team shares everything that's new with Svelte lately.

  • ğŸ•¹ï¸ OneJS is an attempt to bring JavaScript scripting into the Unity game engine. â–¶ï¸Â Here's a screencast showing itÂ off.

  • ğŸ‚ The Knip code decluttering tool celebrates two years with a new release containing a revamped auto-fix mechanism for automatically removing unused exports and files from yourÂ code.

  • Congratulations to Ulises GascÃ³n for becoming the newest TC39 Delegate.

RELEASES:

  • Eleventy / 11ty 3.0 â€“ Node.js-powered static site generator.

  • Tabulator 6.3 â€“ Popular interactive table / data gridÂ control.

  • Jiti 2.0 â€“ Runtime TypeScript and ESM support forÂ Node.js.

  • pnpm 9.12 â€“ The alternative, efficient packageÂ manager.

ViteConf is Live! â€” Join us today and tomorrow for ViteConfÂ 2024!

StackBlitz sponsor

ğŸ“’Â Articles & Tutorials

â–¶Â Â Bundling: The Past, Present and Future â€” A history lesson on bundlers, why theyâ€™re used, the problems they solve, the current ecosystem, and a look at the potential future for theseÂ tools.

Devon Govett

Unleash JavaScript's Potential with Functional Programming â€” More focused on the how, rather than the why, but a good primer nonetheless, especially if youâ€™ve never tried to learn about FPÂ before.

Jan Hesters

An Online Event You Wonâ€™t Want to Miss â€” ğŸ”¥ JetBrains JavaScript Day returns Oct 24, and it promises to be the best one yet! Explore an impressive agenda and register for freeÂ today.

JetBrains sponsor

SVG Coding Examples: Useful Recipes for Writing Vectors by Hand â€” Explores the basics of hand-coding SVGs, how to use JavaScript along the way, and practical examples to demystify the inner workings of common SVGÂ elements.

Myriam Frisano

ğŸ“„ Web Components are Not Framework Components and Thatâ€™s Okay Lea Verou

ğŸ“„ How to Submit an Electron App to the Mac App Store Liu Liu

ğŸ“„ Why Gumroad Didn't Choose htmx Sahil Lavingia

ğŸ“„ How Bun Supports V8 APIs Without using V8 Ben Grant (Bun)

ğŸ“º Laravel vs Rails for JavaScript Developers Sam Lewis

ğŸ› Â Code & Tools

ğŸ¤–Â assistant-ui: React Components for AI Chat â€” It doesnâ€™t just give you the interface components, but has integrations for Vercel AI, Langchain, and talking to other common LLM APIs (e.g. OpenAI), enabling you to build your own in-house AI chat system quickly. Examples.

Simon Farshid

qrframe: A Library to Generate 'Pretty' QR Codes â€” It's slightly odd as the QR codes generated arenâ€™t guaranteed to scan reliably, but if you can generate ones that do, they look striking, and could be useful for branding/fun use cases. Play around with a live demoÂ here.

Kyle Zheng

Announcing MongoDB 8.0 â€” Over 30% Faster Than Before â€” Learn how MongoDB 8.0 was built to exceed the most stringent security, availability, and performanceÂ requirements.

MongoDB 8.0 sponsor

Superdiff 2.0: Compares Two Arrays or Objects and Return a Diff â€” Got two similar objects and want to see the underlyingÂ differences?

antoine

ÂµExpress / Ultimate Express: Like Express, But Faster â€” Imagine a reimplementation of Express with full API compatibility, but based on ÂµWebSockets and with an optimized router for fasterÂ performance.

dimden

VueFormify 1.1: Simple Type-Safe Form Building for Vue â€” Bills itself as â€œyour ticket to form-building autonomy.â€ Thereâ€™s a getting started guide and GitHubÂ repo.

MÃ¡tÃ© Nagy

pretty-print: Customizable String Representations of JS Values â€” Produce a string representation of any value. Similar to util.inspect but with many extra options for tree-ifying, coloring, sorting, choosing what to display, etc.

Effectful Technologies Inc

  • ğŸ—“ï¸ Schedule-X 2.3 â€“ Material Design event calendar and dateÂ picker.

  • Summernote 0.9 â€“ Simple WYSIWYG editor atop Bootstrap andÂ jQuery.

  • ng-dnd 4.0 â€“ Drag and drop solution for Angular. (Demos.)

  • Prisma 5.20 â€“ Popular ORM for Node.js andÂ TypeScript.

  • React95 v9.0 â€“ Make React apps that look like WindowsÂ 95.

  • Vaul 1.0 â€“ Elegant drawer component for React.

  • Eruda 3.4 â€“ A console/devtools for mobileÂ browsers.

  • BlockNote 0.16 â€“ 'Notion-style' block-basedÂ editor.

ğŸ“°Â Classifieds

âš™ï¸ Create entire web apps with Reactile and let it handle your widgets and windows within a single browser tab. 1-month free trial. Try it now.

Automatically creates & maintains E2E UI tests. Zero flakes. Used by Lattice, Bilt Rewards and others. Backed by YC, CTO GitHub and others.

items.title: Deno gets even better
items.content:
#â€‹706 â€” September 26, 2024

Read on the Web

JavaScript Weekly

Deno 2.0 Release Candidate â€” Deno started life as a manifestation of ideas that Nodeâ€™s original creator, Ryan Dahl, had after his experiences with Node. Deno 2 is the next step: how the Deno team thinks Deno should ultimately be. Many changes await: window is gone and Nodeâ€™s process appears, dependency management has been improved, numerous APIs have gone stable (e.g. WebGPU), and both Node.js API and CommonJS support have continued toÂ improve.

Bartek IwaÅ„czuk and Andy Jiang

Don't Sleep on AbortController â€” AbortController is a broadly available mechanism for, originally, aborting Web requests on demand, but you can use it for a lot more than that (or â€˜anything!â€™, as ArtemÂ explains).

Artem Zakharchenko

Learn to Build Feature-Rich, Native Mobile Apps Using React Native and Expo â€” Join Kadi Kraman for a video course designed to hone your React skills. Whether a beginner, or looking to further refine your skill set, you'll learn to create practical iOS and Android apps, covering components, styling, UX, linting, async storage, animation, and muchÂ more.

Frontend Masters sponsor

How Josh W. Comeau Rebuilt His Blog, App Router Style â€” Weâ€™re huge fans of Joshâ€™s blog and heâ€™s just rebuilt it entirely using Next.js, MDX, Sandpack, and an array of other technologies. Here, he goes into great depth about what's involved. A good look behind the scenes of a modern React-drivenÂ project.

Josh W Comeau

IN BRIEF:

  • ğŸ‡ªğŸ‡º NodeConf EU is back. It takes place in Ireland this November 3-6.

  • ğŸŸ¨ It also appears JSConf is coming back under the care of the OpenJSÂ Foundation.

  • ğŸ“Š Minification Benchmarks is a frequently updated set of benchmarks for a suite of popular JavaScriptÂ minifiers.

  • ğŸ•¹ï¸ The most recent JS13kGames gamedev contest just ended. If you want to play the entries (or do some judging yourself) they're all here. I particularly liked The Way of the Dodo andÂ Deep13.

RELEASES:

  • Bun v1.1.29 â€“ Its C compilation feature gets N-API support, but is otherwise largely a bugfixÂ release.

  • Storybook 8.3 â€“ A popular frontend component workshop is now using Vitest to rapidly speed up its component testingÂ features.

  • Strapi 5 â€“ Popular open source headlessÂ CMS.

  • Solid 1.9 â€“ Declarative and performant reactivity for buildingÂ UIs.

  • PostgreSQL 17 â€“ The popular database isn't a JavaScript project, but a lot of you will be usingÂ it. Psst! We have a Postgres newsletterÂ too!

ğŸ“’Â Articles & Tutorials

A Guide to Destructuring in JavaScript â€” The destructuring assignment syntax appeared in ES6 almost ten years ago and has become a central part of modern JavaScript development. This is a good primer/reminder of theÂ potential.

Mat Marquis

The Nine Node Pillars: Principles for Doing Node Right â€” A group of prolific and productive Node.js contributors have put together a checklist to identify gaps in your current Node development practices, particularly when building large-scaleÂ apps.

Snell, Venditto, Dawson, Collina, et al.

A Complete Guide to Session Management in Next.js â€” Learn how integrating session management into your app provides robust security and enhances userÂ experience.

Clerk sponsor

What Are Durable Functions? A Visual JavaScript Primer â€” This is rather dependent on what Inngest, a durable function service, offers, but is a good primer to the general idea which may well suit your useÂ cases.

Lydia Hallie (Inngest)

What's New in Express.js 5.0 â€” Express.js 5.0 landed recently with rather brief release notes, so here's a deeper look at what it has to offer. The updates are largely incremental, but set the stage for Expressâ€™sÂ future.

Trevor I. Lasn

Angular Routing Essentials: Everything in One Post â€” A bold claim, but it does a pretty goodÂ job.

Oleksandr Kocherhin

Using Reddit's JSON API from a JavaScript App â€” How to pull data from Redditâ€™s API and display it in a simple web application built withÂ Parcel.

Muhammed Ali

ğŸ“º Create a Donkey Kong Country-ish Platformer in JS â€“ We donâ€™t see the DKC resemblance, but itâ€™s a solid 4 hourÂ screencast. Chris Courses

ğŸ“„ Implementing a 'Like' Button without Authentication Abhishek Saha

ğŸ› Â Code & Tools

Schedule-X 2: A Modern Event Calendar Component â€” Available in the form of React/Preact, Vue, Svelte, Angular, or plain JS components. Open source but with a premium version with extra features. GitHubÂ repo.

Tom Ã–sterlund

ğŸ§¹Â Vue Mess Detector: Code and Quality Analysis for VueÂ Projects â€” A static analysis tool that can catch various bugs and code quality issues in Vue-based projects, built atop rules from the Vue.js Style Guide and others. GitHubÂ repo.

Various Contributors

âœ‚ï¸ Cut Your QA Cycles Down from Hours to Minutes â€” QA Wolf's AI-native approach gets engineering teams to 80% automated end-to-end test coverage and helps them ship 2x faster by reducing QA cycles from hours toÂ minutes.

QA Wolf sponsor

Tesseract.js: Pure JS OCR for 100+ Languages â€” A port of the C++-based Tesseract library commonly used for extract text from images. The homepage has a live demo where you can drop your own images. GitHubÂ repo.

Tesseract Team

HumanifyJS: Deobfuscate JavaScript Code using ChatGPT â€” Thereâ€™s an in-depth explainer here. The primary feature is its ability to reverse the loss of meaningful variable and function names based on the context of theÂ code.

Jesse Luoto

Tests Are Dead. Meticulous Is Here â€” Automatically creates & maintains E2E UI tests. Zero flakes. Backed by YC, CTO of GitHub, CPO of Adobe, CEO ofÂ Vercel.

Meticulous sponsor

React Snap Carousel: DOM-First, Headless Carousel â€” Uses native browser scrolling and CSS scroll snap points for performance. Try out some of its features in its Storybook. The latest version adds support for infiniteÂ carousels.

Richard Scarrott

ğŸ’¡ For more React projects, check out our latest React newsletter.

  • Perspective 3.1 â€“ Streaming data viz and analytics component. The core is written in C++ and compiled to WebAssembly. The homepage shows it offÂ well.

  • NeutralinoJS 5.4 â€“ Lightweight cross-platform desktop appÂ framework.

  • websocket-as-promised 3.0 â€“ A Promise-based API for WebSockets.

  • Verdaccio 6.0 â€“ Lightweight local private npmÂ registry.

  • Rspack 1.0.7 â€“ Fast Rust-based webÂ bundler.

  • esbuild 0.24

title: JavaScript Weekly
description: A newsletter of JavaScript articles, news and cool projects
